intro: Erigeron wyomingius, commonly known as the Wyoming fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small white to pale yellow flowers in the summer. Erigeron wyomingius is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ecological benefits.
